000000.title: A space or indent
000000.description: This will also reset some formatting such as numbers, all caps, or italics.

100000.title: The letter a
100000.description: This configuration, dot 1, is an example of a letter A, or number 1 (if preceded by a number sign).

110000.title: The letter b
110000.description: When preceded by a number sign, it's the number 2. As a standalone character or a prefix, it's short for but.

100100.title: The letter c
100100.description: In a word, it can signify a double c. When preceded by a number sign, it's the number 3. It's also a contraction for the word can.

100110.title: The letter d
100110.description: When preceded by a number sign, it's the number 4. As a word contraction, it stands for do. Following dot 5, it's day. Ending a word following dot 46, it's -ound.

100010.title: The letter e
100010.description: When preceded by a number sign, it's the number 5. As a word, it stands for every.

110100.title: The letter f
110100.description: In a word, it can signify a double f. When preceded by a number sign, it's the number 6. It's also a contraction for from.

110110.title: The letter g
110110.description: When preceded by a number sign, it's the number 7. As a word contraction, it stands for go. Ending a word following dot 56, it's -ong.

110010.title: The letter h
110010.description: When preceded by a number sign, it's the number 8. It's also a contraction for the word have. Preceded by a dot 5, it's here.

010100.title: The letter i
010100.description: When preceded by a number sign, it's the number 9. It's also a contraction for in. As a suffix, it stands for -ity.

010110.title: The letter j
010110.description: When preceded by a number sign, it's the number 0. It's also a contraction for just.

101000.title: The letter k
101000.description: Contractions: As a word, it's knowledge. Preceded by a dot 5, it's know.

111000.title: The letter l
111000.description: Just an l, but in the middle of a word it often stands for ll. As a word, it can stand for like. Double it for the word little.

101100.title: The letter m
101100.description: Contractions: As a word contraction, it stands for more. Followed by a dot 34, it stands for much.

101110.title: The letter n
101110.description: As a word contraction, it's not. Preceded by a dot 5, it's name.

101010.title: The letter o
101010.description: Contractions: In a word, it's ow. Preceded by a dot 5, it's the word one.

111100.title: The letter p
111100.description: Preceded by a dot 5, it's part. As a word, it's people.

111110.title: The letter q
111110.description: Contractions: On its own it's quite. Preceded by a dot 5, it's a question.

111010.title: The letter r
111010.description: Contractions: As a word, it's rather. Preceded by a dot 5, it's right. It also starts a few words, like receive and rejoice.

011100.title: The letter s
011100.description: Contractions: As a word, it's so. Preceded by a dot 5, it's said.

011110.title: The letter t
011110.description: Contractions: As a word, it's that. Preceded by a dot 5, it's time. Followed by a dot 125, it's the.

101001.title: The letter u
101001.description: Contractions: As a word, it's us. Preceded by a dot 5, it's under. Preceded by a dot 45, it's upon.

111001.title: The letter v
111001.description: Contractions: As a single word contraction, this is very.

010111.title: The letter w
010111.description: Contractions: As a single word, this is will. Also used in contractions such as work, world, would, and word.

101101.title: The letter x
101101.description: Contractions: X marks the spot, but also marks the word it. Followed by an s, it's its, and followed by an f, it's itself.

101111.title: The letter y
101111.description: Contractions: As a word, it's you. Followed by an r, it's your. Preceded by a dot 5, it's young.

101011.title: The letter z
101011.description: Contractions: As a single letter word, it stands for as.

010000.title: A comma
010000.description: This is a simple punctuation mark used to separate clauses in sentences.

010001.title: A semicolon
010001.description: Nothing more to say here; it's a semicolon. It's used in some contractions that start with 'be'.

010010.title: A colon
010010.description: This punctuation mark is used to introduce lists, explanations, or quotations.

010011.title: A period
010011.description: This ends a sentence, full stop, for when you need to drop the mic.

001000.title: An apostrophe
001000.description: Assuredly an apostrophe (and not used in any contractions).

111111.title: The word for
111111.description: This is really not used for anything else.
